title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 September 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
00:29 <polx> has quit  
00:32 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
00:43 <abusenius> has quit  
01:02 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
01:23 <UCC> has quit  
01:35 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
01:54 <polx> has quit  
03:03 <Denis> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
07:03 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:08 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:27 <vmassol> has quit  
08:05 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:26 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <sdumitriu> has quit  
08:39 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <sburjan> has quit  
08:59 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <sburjan> Hello. Andybody has any idea why on a 5.2-SNAP without Snapshot repos activated, EM finds extensions with version 5.0.3 ? I was expecting 5.1  
09:54 <vmassol> has quit  
09:58 <tmortagne> sburjan: which extension ?  
10:04 <npst> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <msmeria> has quit  
10:04 <npst> morning  
10:05 <sburjan> has quit  
10:06 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <npst> I was wondering where I would change the pattern of the suggested username when creating a new user as admin  
10:07 <npst> do i have to maybe edit some sources?  
10:10 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <sburjan> tmortagne: wiki manager for example, but there are others too  
10:14 <tmortagne> sburjan: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Wiki+Manager+Application  
10:14 <tmortagne> here is your answer  
10:15 <tmortagne> it's not up to date  
10:15 <tmortagne> always the same thing  
10:15 <tmortagne> started the update  
10:17 <npst> aaah, devspam! :D  
10:18 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <sburjan> tmortagne: isn't there a way to do this automatically ?  
10:21 <tmortagne> sburjan: there is but we disabled it  
10:22 <tmortagne> for some reason on xwiki.org and only there extension are saved all the time even when there is no modifications  
10:37 <npst> is it over? :D  
10:37 <tmortagne> looks like it  
10:38 <npst> so, i was wondering... the registration page uses the function "prepareName" to build a suggested username. where would i find it?  
10:49 <UCC> has quit  
10:54 <npst> Noone? :/  
10:58 <cjd> possibly xwiki.js, it's a bit old so I don't remember exactly  
11:01 <cjd> user@ubnta8:~/wrk/xwiki-trunks/xwiki-platform$ find ./xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web -name '\*.js' -exec grep 'prepareName' {} \; -print  
11:01 <cjd> user@ubnta8:~/wrk/xwiki-trunks/xwiki-platform$  
11:02 <npst> indeed, /bin/skin/resources/js/xwiki/xwiki.js has it  
11:02 <npst> not sure where i can edit it, tho ^^  
11:04 <cjd> instead you might try using a skin extension to override it  
11:04 <cjd> as long as your extension is loaded after xwiki.js, you're good  
11:04 <cjd> (they all are)  
11:06 <npst> extensions sound good, but for now i'll go with overriding the function in the registration page i think: http://lists.xwiki.org/pipermail/users/2011-April/019625.html  
11:06 <npst> thanks for your help :)  
12:15 <npst> has quit  
12:56 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:10 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
13:13 <vmassol> hello, back from a presentation and demo about xwiki  
13:14 <vmassol> went well except that I think I've found a but related to extensions and multiwiki :)  
13:14 <vmassol> I'll try to reproduce and create a jira issue this afternoon and hopefully we can fix before 5.2 final  
13:29 <mflorea> has quit  
13:29 <sburjan> vmassol: seems I also found another bug. when deleting the workspaces template from a jetty+hsqldb XWiki instance, I get 3 tons of stacktraces, but from the UI everything looks normal  
13:30 <sburjan> seems throwm by SOLR  
13:38 <fmancinelli> has quit  
13:45 <sburjan> vmassol: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9498  
13:47 <sburjan> could you put it as fixFor 5.2 RC1 ? it's useless otherwise  
13:48 <vmassol> tmortagne/guillaume: could you check http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9499 ?  
13:49 <vmassol> sburjan: done  
13:49 <sburjan> thanks  
13:51 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
13:51 <sburjan> vmassol: is there any particular reason we decided to remove Blog from the subwiki template ?  
13:52 <sburjan> don't we want to allow users to have blogs in their subwikis ?  
13:52 <vmassol> sburjan: see the jira issue  
13:52 <vmassol> you can comment there if you don't like it  
13:52 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9346  
13:53 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <sburjan> I don't quite like it, but I understand the POV that in the future, we'lll have the flavors, so users can install what they want :)  
13:54 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: users can install the blog manually thought the extension manager  
13:54 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: but there is no reason for having it every time!  
13:54 <vmassol> sburjan: they can already install what they want  
13:54 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: we could say the same for the blog in defalut XE and for a lot of apps though  
13:54 <vmassol> it's not a good enough reason because we still need to offer most common apps  
13:55 <vmassol> (flavors do that)  
13:55 <vmassol> (but flavors don't exist yet)  
13:55 <vmassol> I also found it a bit early to remove but I didn't want to block it  
13:56 <sburjan> I'm QA, I need to know there things so I know that they are not bugs :)  
13:56 <vmassol> which is why  
13:56 <vmassol> I asked gdelhumeau to put it in the RN  
13:56 <vmassol> :)  
13:56 <vmassol> (see my comment in the issue)  
13:57 <gdelhumeau> I just saw it ;)  
13:57 <gdelhumeau> I did my PR yesterday, just before leaving, sorry for that sburjan  
13:58 <sburjan> no problem, I can always ask here what I don't know :)  
13:58 <sburjan> I'm here to piss off the devs :)  
14:02 <sburjan`> has quit  
14:03 <gdelhumeau> ;)  
14:20 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
14:21 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: do you still have open PR that need to be applied right now?  
14:22 <vmassol> ah yes this one: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/173/files doint it  
14:22 <gdelhumeau> yep  
14:23 <gdelhumeau> and this one https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/pull/47 but Marius and Thomas handle it ;)  
14:23 <vmassol> ok not touching 47  
14:23 <vmassol> mf   
14:23 <vmassol> grr  
14:23 <vmassol> tmortagne/mflorea: are we going to be able to release today?  
14:41 <Denis> has quit  
14:46 <fmancinelli> has quit  
14:46 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
14:54 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I have noticed that the Search feature propose to search on "workspacetemplate"  
14:54 <gdelhumeau> I think it should not  
14:55 <gdelhumeau> the user should not be aware of the template, and never getting content from it  
14:55 <vmassol> you mean in the list of wikis in the facet?  
14:55 <vmassol> or in the advanced search actually  
14:55 <gdelhumeau> yes, and in the default results  
14:55 <vmassol> it's considered a wiki like any other  
14:55 <tmortagne> well somtime you could want to search there  
14:55 <vmassol> well we don't have the notion of hidden wikis yet :)  
14:55 <gdelhumeau> "refine your search"  
14:56 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: I think you can search inside the template... if you are already in  
14:56 <vmassol> bbiab  
14:56 <gdelhumeau> but when you are on the "home" wiki, and you start a research, you should not see content from workspacetemplate  
14:57 <tmortagne> sure, but I mean you could want to search something in the entire farm, this wiki included  
14:57 <tmortagne> but yes we could require you to enabled hidden wiki for example  
14:57 <gdelhumeau> yes  
14:57 <tmortagne> but that does not exist :)  
14:57 <gdelhumeau> or maybe we could only use the "template" wiki notion  
14:57 <gdelhumeau> if the wiki is a template, then it should be hidden  
14:58 <tmortagne> I doubt it's a blocker for 5.2  
14:58 <tmortagne> we can discuss it in 5.3  
14:58 <gdelhumeau> not a blocker, but it is not nice :/  
14:58 <gdelhumeau> at least on the search engine  
14:59 <tmortagne> I think we need something more generic than the search engine, hidden wiki would be nice, and we also use that occasion to do hidden space maybe  
14:59 <tmortagne> s/we/we can/  
15:00 <gdelhumeau> indeed, this morning, Jean asked me if we can hide a space  
15:00 <gdelhumeau> easily  
15:02 <tmortagne> there is a hardcoded blacklist of spaces supported by search but it's not very nice  
15:02 <vmassol> has quit  
15:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:15 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
15:17 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: it seems I still get the DW on newly created workspaces on SNAP even when enabling the SNAP repository  
15:18 <gdelhumeau> did you enable the SNAP repo before creating the workspace template?  
15:20 <sburjan> yes  
15:26 <gdelhumeau> I've just tried with my maven repo, no DW  
15:26 <gdelhumeau> I never tried with the snapshot repo  
15:29 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:38 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: I did.. with the latest snapshot  
15:38 <sburjan> maybe it's not that important, but it confuses me when testing  
15:42 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: I'm looking  
15:44 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: I just did with http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/5.2-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-5.2-20130923.173720-136.zip  
15:45 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: me too ! and you did not get any DW ?  
15:46 <gdelhumeau> with extension.repositories=maven-xwiki-snapshot:maven:http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots  
15:46 <gdelhumeau> no DW :/  
15:46 <gdelhumeau> with Add > Wiki  
15:46 <sburjan> I have also uncommented the default values  
15:47 <gdelhumeau> hmm  
15:47 <gdelhumeau> I only uncommit this line  
15:47 <gdelhumeau> s/incommit/uncomment  
15:47 <sburjan> afaik you need to uncomment the other 2 also  
15:47 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: it should work with different repositories?  
15:48 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: if the question is does EM check on all repository then yes EM check on all repositories  
15:48 <tmortagne> you have two repositories by default as indicated  
15:49 <sburjan> afaik tmortagne told me that the default ones have to also be uncommented  
15:49 <tmortagne> sburjan: depends what you want to do  
15:49 <gdelhumeau> so why, when I only set the snapshot repo, the extension ID are recognized, and when sburjan uncommit the snapshot repo + the defaults, it does not?  
15:49 <tmortagne> each repository has different extensions  
15:50 <tmortagne> if you put only the snapsnot maven repository you won't be able to search for extensions in e.x.o or install stables versions  
15:50 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: did you tried with the default and the snapshot yourself ?  
15:50 <gdelhumeau> nope  
15:51 <tmortagne> maybe sburjan did something else wrong  
15:51 <gdelhumeau> ok, I'll try  
15:51 <tmortagne> sburjan: make sure the snapshot repository is listed in Add extensions  
15:52 <tmortagne> you should look at the log also to see if you have any related error  
15:53 <sburjan> tmortagne: Listed in Add extensions.. where ? I don't see anything  
15:53 <sburjan> some extensions have: mngalagiu alexandru  
15:53 <tmortagne> sburjan: you can choose the repository where to search  
15:53 <tmortagne> you have All by default  
15:53 <sburjan> Version 5.2-SNAPSHOT is provided  
15:53 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:53 <sburjan> yes, I have ALL, Core, Instaled, Local,  
15:54 <tillo> has quit  
15:54 <lynxt> has quit  
15:54 <sburjan`> has quit  
15:54 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
15:54 <lynxt> has joined #xwiki  
15:55 <tmortagne> right, it's not listing remote repository actually  
15:55 <sburjan`> has quit  
15:55 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
15:55 <sburjan> I don't remember listing snapshot option in the dropdown  
15:55 <tillo> has joined #xwiki  
15:56 <gdelhumeau> still no DW :/  
15:56 <sburjan> wtf  
15:57 <tmortagne> sburjan: could you paste your xwiki.cfg ?  
15:57 <sburjan> tmortagne: I just deleted my xwiki instance, starting from 0  
15:57 <tmortagne> xwiki.properties sorry  
15:59 <vmassol> has quit  
15:59 <tmortagne> sburjan: put the following code somewhere if you still have the issue  
15:59 <tmortagne> {{velocity}}  
15:59 <tmortagne> #end  
15:59 <tmortagne> {{/velocity}}  
15:59 <tmortagne> that will list you all the registered repository, to make sure you have the snapshot one  
16:00 <tmortagne> repositories  
16:00 <tmortagne> sburjan: you could also try with only the snapshot one see if it change anything  
16:01 <tmortagne> maybe your left a typo somewhere in xwiki.properties when editing it  
16:01 <sburjan> now I have started from 0  
16:01 <sburjan> we'll find out in 3 minutes if I did the same mistake or it's a bug  
16:02 <UCC> has quit  
16:02 <sburjan> tmortagne, gdelhumeau: no DW  
16:03 <tmortagne> sburjan: ok  
16:03 <sburjan> so I was making something wrong  
16:03 <tmortagne> probably a typo  
16:03 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: after creating the first subwiki/workspace, is that normal that I have a home icon in the top menu ?  
16:03 <tmortagne> we should probably find some where to enable the snapshot repository too in snapshot version  
16:03 <sburjan> and if I delete the workspace, the icon gets back  
16:04 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: yes, it is  
16:04 <tmortagne> s/where/way/  
16:04 <sburjan> ok, cool  
16:04 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: if there is a subwiki, we consider that it's a multi-wiki instance  
16:04 <gdelhumeau> so we change the menu  
16:04 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: that's cool, I like the idea  
16:04 <gdelhumeau> I have made a proposal on the ML to always have the home icon, even on a single wiki  
16:14 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:26 <mflorea> vmassol: what's the status on CI regarding VNC changes you made? I see some strange errors, like "All available display numbers are allocated or blacklisted."  
16:27 <vmassol> mflorea: yes I 've noticed this and normally fixed it  
16:27 <vmassol> I've restarted a new build right now  
16:27 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/2749/console  
16:27 <mflorea> ok  
16:27 <vmassol> to verify it works fine  
16:27 <vmassol> this one worked: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-misc/  
16:27 <vmassol> (the last build)  
16:27 <vmassol> so it seems ok  
16:28 <mflorea> are all agents fixed or just some?  
16:28 <vmassol> all  
16:28 <mflorea> ok, I'll start some of the failing jobs  
16:28 <vmassol> ok  
16:34 <mflorea> vmassol: no luck http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/2749/  
16:38 <mflorea> actually there seems to be just a failing test, I'm not sure why "VNC connection issue!" is displayed. Maybe we need to update the code that labels the builds.  
16:45 <mflorea> java.lang.InternalError: Can't connect to X11 window server using ':11' as the value of the DISPLAY variable.  
16:46 <mflorea> it seems this is needed by DefaultImageCaptchaAction  
16:51 <mflorea> on a different agent (4) Error: cannot open display: :19  
16:52 <mflorea> agent 11 Error: cannot open display: :39  
16:55 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:16 <mflorea> could be related http://architects.dzone.com/articles/testing-hudsonjenkins-problems  
17:16 <vmassol> mflorea: hmmm  
17:17 <vmassol> (just back, was away)  
17:18 <mflorea> I see "created VNC server for screen 0" although Xvnc is called with :39 (or any display number > 0) so either the log id wrong or Xvnc doesn't create the requested display  
17:18 <vmassol> [xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping] $ /usr/bin/Xvnc :11 -desktop jenkins-agent -auth /home/hudsonagent/.Xauthority -geometry 1280x800 -depth 24 -rfbwait 30000 -rfbauth /home/hudsonagent/.vnc/passwd -rfbport 5983 -fp catalogue:/etc/X11/fontpath.d -pn -localhost -nolisten tcp  
17:18 <vmassol> on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/2749/consoleText  
17:18 <vmassol> so it opened :11  
17:19 <vmassol> screen 0 is the physical screen AFAIK  
17:19 <vmassol> (well not physical here obviously)  
17:19 <mflorea> ak, so "created VNC server for screen 0" doesn't matter  
17:19 <vmassol> but it's different from :11 I think  
17:19 <vmassol> yep I think so  
17:20 <mflorea> checkout http://architects.dzone.com/articles/testing-hudsonjenkins-problems  
17:22 <vmassol> yep I will, in a sec, I'm debugging a problem with ludovic right now  
17:22 <mflorea> ok  
17:23 <mflorea> I need to go unfortunately, so no release today.. let's hope for tomorrow early morning  
17:24 <vmassol> ok...  
17:24 <vmassol> sburjan: would be nice if you guys could validate the latest changes  
17:24 <vmassol> the upgrade for ex  
17:24 <vmassol> it's supposed to work well now  
17:25 <sburjan> vmassol: ok, I'll start tomorrow first hour  
17:29 <msmeria> has quit  
17:36 <mflorea> has quit  
17:38 <sburjan> has quit  
17:48 <gdelhumeau> FYI, the upgrade has been just fixed with the last PR  
17:52 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:56 <gdelhumeau> The upgrade all wikis works, from my side  
17:57 <gdelhumeau> I have to go  
17:57 <gdelhumeau> good evening  
17:58 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:06 <sburjan`> has quit  
18:13 <fmancinelli> has quit
